metadata.title: CVE-2019-12107 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The upnp_event_prepare function in upnpevents.c in MiniUPnP MiniUPnPdthrough 2.1 allows a remote attacker to leak information from the heap dueto improper validation of an snprintf return value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

miniupnpd - 1.8.20140523-4.1+deb9u2build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: miniupnpd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.20140523-4.1+deb9u2build0.16.04.1').
